awd_titl_txt: Interagency Agreement - Minority Achievement in Science     and Engineering
awd_abstract_narration: This is an interagency agreement between the Department of                      Education (National Center for Education Statistics) and the                    National Science Foundation for the study of issues relating to                 minority students' achievement in science and mathematics.  Its                 primary purpose is to examine the current status of achievement                 among minorities and to identify various student, home, and school              factors that help students learn science and mathematics.  Both                 descriptive and higher-level statistical analysis strategies will               be used, depending on the nature of issues to be addressed.                     Results of analysis will be summarized and discussed in a report                prepared for dissemination to the general public.  Results of this              study will provide an informed basis for developing programs and                improving educational practices for minorities.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics.
